title: Man arrested after four hour siege at house in St Kilda, Melbourne
text:
A man has been arrested by police armed with assault rifles after a four-hour standoff in Melbourne.

The arrest came after a distressed woman was seen running from the house screaming, in St Kilda East on Wednesday around 7.40am.

Police brandishing assault rifles and a dog squad surrounded the house amid fears a woman had been assaulted by the man at the home at Westbury Street.

Police packing assault rifles and an armoured personnel carrier have arrested a man after a four hour stand off (pictured)

Officers with a dog squad surrounded the house amid fears a woman had been assaulted by the man at the address at Westbury Street, St Kilda in Melbourne (pictured)

Victoria Police said in a statement that the woman had been taken to hospital.

During the four-hour ordeal, the entire suburban street had been shut down.

Officers carrying shields bashed the door down around 9.30am but left the house without the man in question.

A police negotiator managed to convince the suspect to exit the house before taking him into custody just after 1pm.

An elderly neighbour Josie Mandrio, told The Herald Sun that two officers wielding assault rifles had used ladders to climb over her back fence during the siege.

After the four hour ordeal, the man in question was taken to hospital under police guard (pictured)

Another resident from the area said they had heard a man yelling 'I'm a good bloke' to police.

The man was taken to hospital under police guard.

Officers have remained at the address and the incident is still ongoing.

Police managed to negotiate with the man to leave the house and he was taken into custody around 1pm
description: Armed police arrived after a distressed woman was seen running from the house screaming, in St Kilda East in Melbourne on Wednesday around 7.40am.
authors: Eliza Mcphee For Daily Mail Australia
